name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3479
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-N-(1-methylpropyl)-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide has a melting point that is influenced by the functional groups in the molecule relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +30°C. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10°C. The fluorine atoms increase the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +5°C per atom. The nitrogen atom introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +5°C. The carbonyl group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C.
